intro: Lasiandra tibouchinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf tibouchin, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows as an upright shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Lasiandra tibouchinoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil and full sun.
